com.github.nosan.embedded.cassandra.spring

Annotation Type Cql


  • @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Documented
 @Inherited
 @Repeatable(value=CqlScripts.class)
public @interface Cql
    @Cql is used to annotate a test method to configure CQL scripts() and statements() to be executed against a given cluster during integration tests.

    Script execution is performed by the CqlExecutionListener, which is enabled by default.

    This annotation may be used as a meta-annotation to create custom composed annotations with attribute overrides.

    Author:
    Dmytro Nosan
    See Also:
    CqlScripts, CqlExecutionListener

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String cluster
      The bean name of the Cluster against which the scripts should be executed.
      String encoding
      The encoding for the supplied CQL scripts, if different from the platform encoding.
      Cql.ExecutionPhase executionPhase
      When the CQL scripts and statements should be executed.
      String[] scripts
      The paths to the CQL scripts to execute.
      String[] statements
      Inlined CQL statements to execute.
      String[] value
      Alias for scripts().

    • Element Detail

      • value

        @AliasFor(value="scripts")
public abstract String[] value
        Alias for scripts().

        This attribute may not be used in conjunction with scripts(), but it may be used instead of scripts().

        Returns:
        CQL scripts.
        See Also:
        scripts()
        Default:
        {}

      • scripts

        @AliasFor(value="value")
public abstract String[] scripts
        The paths to the CQL scripts to execute.

        This attribute may not be used in conjunction with value(), but it may be used instead of value().

        Path Resource Semantics

        Each path will be interpreted as a Spring Resource. A plain path — for example, "schema.cql" — will be treated as a classpath resource that is relative to the package in which the test class is defined. A path starting with a slash will be treated as an absolute classpath resource, for example: "/org/example/schema.cql". A path which references a URL (e.g., a path prefixed with http:, etc.) will be loaded using the specified resource protocol. A path which contains "⁄**⁄**.cql" will be handled by ResourcePatternResolver.

        Returns:
        CQL Scripts
        See Also:
        value()
        Default:
        {}

      • statements

        public abstract String[] statements
        Inlined CQL statements to execute.

        This attribute may be used in conjunction with or instead of scripts().

        Ordering

        Statements declared via this attribute will be executed after statements loaded from scripts().

        Returns:
        CQL statements
        See Also:
        scripts()
        Default:
        {}

      • encoding

        public abstract String encoding
        The encoding for the supplied CQL scripts, if different from the platform encoding.

        An empty string denotes that the platform encoding should be used.

        Returns:
        CQL scripts encoding.
        Default:
        ""

      • executionPhase

        public abstract Cql.ExecutionPhase executionPhase
        When the CQL scripts and statements should be executed.

        Defaults to BEFORE_TEST_METHOD.

        Returns:
        Execution phase.
        Default:
        com.github.nosan.embedded.cassandra.spring.Cql.ExecutionPhase.BEFORE_TEST_METHOD

      • cluster

        public abstract String cluster
        The bean name of the Cluster against which the scripts should be executed.

        The name is only required if there is more than one bean of type Cluster in the test's ApplicationContext. If there is only one such bean, it is not necessary to specify a bean name.

        Defaults to an empty string, requiring that one of the following is true:

        1. There is only one bean of type Cluster in the test's ApplicationContext.
        2. There is a primary bean of type Cluster in the test's ApplicationContext.
        3. The Cluster bean to use is named "cluster".
        Returns:
        Cluster bean name.
        Default:
        ""
